sect1.title: Build Flags
sect1.para: We will need to setup target specific flags for the compiler and linkers. You can choose the appropriate BUILD32 and BUILD64 from the table at the bottom of the page.

screen.userinput: export BUILD32="[BUILD32 entries]" export BUILD64="[BUILD64 entries]" export GCCTARGET=[GCCTARGET entries]"

sect1.para: You will need to set your host target triplet for 32 bit:

screen.userinput: if [ "${LFS_HOST}" = "${LFS_TARGET32}" ]; then \ echo "Host and Target can't be the same." ; fi

sect1.para: If the above test gave you "Host and Target can't be the same", you will need to change your LFS_HOST to a a different target triplet:
Lets add the build flags to ~/.bashrc to prevent issues if we stop and come back later.

screen.userinput: echo export BUILD32=\""${BUILD32}\"" >> ~/.bashrc echo export BUILD64=\""${BUILD64}\"" >> ~/.bashrc echo export GCCTARGET=\""${GCCTARGET}\"" >> ~/.bashrc echo export LFS_TARGET32=\""${LFS_TARGET32}\"" >> ~/.bashrc echo export LFS_HOST=\""${LFS_HOST}\"" >> ~/.bashrc
